LightQuery.jl

  • Readme
  • Docstrings
    • Docstrings
    Docstrings
    LightQuery.@> — Macro.
    macro >(body)

    If body is in the form body_ |> tail_, call @_ on tail, and recur on body.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> @> 0 |> _ + 1 |> _ - 1
0
    LightQuery.@_ — Macro.
    macro _(body::Expr)

    Create an Nameless object. The arguments are inside the body; the first arguments is _, the second argument is __, etc. Also stores a quoted version of the function.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> 1 |> @_(_ + 1)
2

julia> map(@_(__ - _), (1, 2), (2, 1))
(1, -1)

julia> @_(_ + 1).expression
:(_ + 1)
    LightQuery.By — Type.
    By(it, f)

    Marks that it has been pre-sorted by the key f.

    LightQuery.Cap
    LightQuery.Couples
    LightQuery.Enumerate
    LightQuery.History
    LightQuery.LeftJoin — Type.
    LeftJoin(left::By, right::By)

    For each value in left, look for a value with the same key in right.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> LeftJoin(
            By([1, 2, 5, 6], identity),
            By([1, 3, 4, 6], identity)
       ) |> collect
4-element Array{Pair{Int64,Union{Missing, Int64}},1}:
 1 => 1
 2 => missing
 5 => missing
 6 => 6
    LightQuery.LightQuery
    LightQuery.ModelArray
    LightQuery.Name — Type.
    Name(name)
    julia> using LightQuery

julia> Name(:a)((a = 1, b = 2.0,))
1
    LightQuery.Nameless — Type.

    A container for a function and the expression that generated it

    LightQuery.Names — Type.
    struct Names{T} end
    julia> using LightQuery

julia> Names(:a, :b)((a = 1, b = 2.0, c = 3//1))
(a = 1, b = 2.0)
    LightQuery.SkipRepeats
    LightQuery.arrays
    LightQuery.based_on — Function.
    based_on(data; assignments...)

    Apply the functions in assignments to data, and assign to the corresponding keys.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> based_on((a = 1, b = 2.0), c = @_ _.a + _.b)
(c = 3.0,)
    LightQuery.chain
    LightQuery.column — Function.
    column(it, names::Names)

    Lazy find name for each item in it.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> it = [(a = 1, b = 1.0), (a = 2, b = 2.0)];

julia> collect(column(it, :a))
2-element Array{Int64,1}:
 1
 2
    LightQuery.combine_iterator_eltype
    LightQuery.downsize
    LightQuery.eval
    LightQuery.gather — Function.
    gather(data, new_column, columns...)

    Gather all the data in columns into a single new_column.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> gather((a = 1, b = 2.0, c = "c"), :d, :a, :c)
(b = 2.0, d = (a = 1, c = "c"))
    LightQuery.group — Function.
    group(b::By)

    Group consecutive keys in b.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> group(By([1, 3, 2, 4], iseven)) |> collect
2-element Array{Pair{Bool,SubArray{Int64,1,Array{Int64,1},Tuple{UnitRange{Int64}},true}},1}:
 false => [1, 3]
  true => [2, 4]
    LightQuery.group_inner
    LightQuery.in_common — Function.
    in_common(data1, data2)

    Find Names in common.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> in_common((a = 1, b = 2.0), (a = 1, c = "3"))
Names{(:a,)}()

    LightQuery.key — Function.
    key(pair)

    The first item

    LightQuery.maybe_setindex_widen_up_to
    LightQuery.name — Function.
    name(data, names...)

    Rename data

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> name((a = 1, b = 2.0), :c, :d)
(c = 1, d = 2.0)
    LightQuery.named — Function.
    named(data)

    Convert to a named tuple

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> named((a = 1, b = 2.0))
(a = 1, b = 2.0)

julia> struct Triple{T1, T2, T3}
            first::T1
            second::T2
            third::T3
        end;

julia> Base.propertynames(t::Triple) = (:first, :second, :third);

julia> named(Triple(1, 1.0, "a"))
(first = 1, second = 1.0, third = "a")
    LightQuery.over
    LightQuery.previous_index
    LightQuery.remove — Function.
    remove(data, columns...)

    Remove columns.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> remove((a = 1, b = 2.0), :b)
(a = 1,)
    LightQuery.rename — Function.
    rename(data; renames...)

    For type stability, use Name.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> rename((a = 1, b = 2.0), c = Name(:a))
(b = 2.0, c = 1)
    LightQuery.rows — Function.
    rows(n::NamedTuple)

    Iterator over rows of a NamedTuple of columns.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> rows((a = [1, 2], b = [2, 1])) |> first
(a = 1, b = 2)
    LightQuery.seek_right_match
    LightQuery.select — Function.
    select(data, columns...)

    Select columns

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> select((a = 1, b = 2.0), :a)
(a = 1,)
    LightQuery.separate — Function.
    separate(it, into_names...)

    Column-wise storage.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> it = [(a = 1, b = 1.0), (a = 2, b = 2.0)];

julia> result = separate(it, :a, :b);

julia> first(result)
(a = 1, b = 1.0)
    LightQuery.spread — Function.
    spread(data, column::Name)

    Unnest nested data in column

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> spread((b = 2.0, d = (a = 1, c = "c")), :d)
(b = 2.0, a = 1, c = "c")
    LightQuery.string_length
    LightQuery.substitute_cap
    LightQuery.substitute_underscores!
    LightQuery.transform — Function.
    transform(data; assignments...)

    Same as based_on, but merge back in the original.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> transform((a = 1, b = 2.0), c = @_ _.a + _.b)
(a = 1, b = 2.0, c = 3.0)
    LightQuery.unname — Function.
    unname

    Remove names. Explicitly define public propertynames for arbitrary structs.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> unname((a = 1, b = 2.0))
(1, 2.0)

julia> unname((1, 2.0))
(1, 2.0)

julia> struct Triple{T1, T2, T3}
            first::T1
            second::T2
            third::T3
        end;

julia> Base.propertynames(t::Triple) = (:first, :second, :third);

julia> unname(Triple(1, 1.0, "a"))
(1, 1.0, "a")

    LightQuery.unname_simple
    LightQuery.unzip — Function.
    unzip(it, n)

    Unzip an iterator it which returns tuples of length n.

    julia> using LightQuery

julia> f(x) = (x, x + 1.0);

julia> unzip(over([1], f), 2)
([1], [2.0])

julia> unzip(over([1, missing], f), 2);

julia> unzip(zip([1], [1.0]), 2)
([1], [1.0])

julia> unzip([(1, 1.0)], 2)
([1], [1.0])

    value(pair)

    The second item

    LightQuery.value_field_types
